intro: Cyrtandra didissandriformis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra didissandriformis is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
